labels.analysis: The Fewsats Server is designed to enable secure purchasing and payment management through AI agent integration with the Fewsats platform. Its core functionality revolves around handling financial transactions, including retrieving wallet balances, managing payment methods, processing payments, and retrieving payment and billing information. This server solves problems related to seamless, secure payment processing and transaction management, making it ideal for e-commerce, financial services, or any application requiring automated payment solutions.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is selected as "Financial Services" because the server's primary functionality revolves around handling payments, transactions, and billing information, which are core aspects of financial services. Secondary labels include "Cryptocurrency & Blockchain" (due to the mention of wallet balances and payment methods) and "E-commerce" (as it facilitates purchasing processes). A custom label is added to highlight the specific integration with Fewsats.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Fewsats Server
server_info_crawled.author: @Fewsats/fewsats-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable AI agents to securely purchase items through a seamless integration with Fewsats. Retrieve wallet balances, payment methods, and manage transactions effortlessly. Simplify your purchasing process with secure payment handling and detailed transaction information.

tools.name: balance
tools.description: Deploy Server Fewsats Server Claim Server @Fewsats/fewsats-mcp Try in Playground

tools.name: payment_methods
tools.description: Retrieve the user's payment methods. You will rarely need to call this unless instructed by the user, or to troubleshoot payment issues. Fewsats will automatically select the best payment method.

tools.name: pay_offer
tools.description: Pays an offer_id from the l402_offers. The l402_offer parameter must be a dict with this structure: 'offers': [ 'offer_id': 'test_offer_2', # String identifier for the offer 'amount': 1, # Numeric cost value 'currency': 'usd', # Currency code 'description': 'Test offer', # Text description 'title': 'Test Package' # Title of the package 'payment_context_token': '60a8e027-8b8b-4ccf-b2b9-380ed0930283', # Payment context token 'payment_request_url': 'https://api.fewsats.com/v0/l402/payment-request', # Payment URL 'version': '0.2.2' # API version Returns payment status response. If payment status is `needs_review` inform the user he will have to approve it at app.fewsats.com

tools.name: payment_info
tools.description: Retrieve the details of a payment. If payment status is `needs_review` inform the user he will have to approve it at app.fewsats.com

tools.name: billing_info
tools.description: Retrieve the user's billing information. Returns billing details including name, address, and other relevant information. This information can also be used as shipping address for purchases.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Fewsats/fewsats-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: fewsatsApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Your Fewsats API key from fewsats.com
